title: 110_hr2810
content: Credit for biomethane produced from biomass is now equivalent to the credit for electricity produced from biomass. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 has been amended to provide a credit for biomethane produced from biomass equivalent to the credit for electricity produced from biomass. The credit amount is determined based on the amount of biomethane produced from biomass. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 has been amended to provide a credit for biomethane produced from biomass, which is gas meeting requirements to be transported in a natural gas pipeline as a substitute. Biomethane must be produced at a biomethane facility and sold to an unrelated person during the taxable year. Biomass is defined as per section 45K(c)(3). The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 has been amended to provide a credit for biomethane produced from biomass, which is gas meeting requirements to be transported in a natural gas pipeline as a substitute. Rules similar to subsection (b)(3) apply for determining any increase under this paragraph. Facilities producing electricity before January 1, 2008 are also considered for the credit. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 has been amended to provide a credit for biomethane produced from biomass. Facilities producing electricity from methane are eligible for the credit, with specific conditions outlined for when the facility is considered placed in service. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 has been amended to provide a credit for biomethane produced from biomass. A biomethane facility is defined as any facility placed in service after December 31, 2007, and before January 1, 2017. The term does not include facilities eligible for other tax credits for fuel production. The amendments made by this section apply to biomethane produced and sold after December 31, 2007, as per the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.
